package.name: Mail
package.summary: Class that provides multiple interfaces for sending emails
package.description: PEAR's Mail:: package defines the interface for implementing mailers under the PEAR hierarchy, and provides supporting functions useful in multiple mailer backends. Currently supported are native PHP mail() function, sendmail and SMTP. This package also provides a RFC 822 Email address list validation utility class.

release.notes: - The 'mail' driver now returns a PEAR_Error object on failure. - The individual drivers no longer include the 'Mail.php' file. If you want to instantiate a driver directly, you'll need to explicitly include the 'Mail.php' file yourself.
The 'localhost' value can now be set in the SMTP driver.
Minor fixes with newlines in headers.
The Mail package now depends on Net_SMTP 1.1.0 or greater for its SMTP authentication capabilities.
Minor additions and changes to RFC822.php. Fixed line terminator issue for smtp.php and set smtp.php to use Return-Path header in place of From header for MAIL FROM: (if supplied)
